%PLAYERNAME%, it’s a relief to see you in these tumultuous times. This storm is unlike anything I’ve ever seen.
We’ve also received unusual reports of more Dynamax Pokémon appearing at Power Spots.
My research notes came up empty, but I recall a legend I heard from another professor about the appearance of a gigantic Pokémon amid dark storms.
The current situation does seem to match their research notes, but could it be...?
Well, let’s investigate nearby Power Spots. Stay alert and be safe, %PLAYERNAME%.
My suspicions were correct. Eternamax Eternatus has arrived!
The research I discovered mentions there are infinite amounts of energy pouring from its enlarged core, warping the surrounding space-time.
Eternatus may explain the recent appearances of Zacian and Zamazenta. We may need their help with one more epic battle!
Battling Eternamax Eternatus will be more challenging than any Gigantamax Pokémon we’ve faced so far.
Coordinate your strategy with your Pokémon and other Trainers thoughtfully. We’re counting on you, %PLAYERNAME%!
What a superb display of skill and determination!
This is one of the most significant battles I’ve ever witnessed. Your Pokémon must be proud of you, too.
While it’s unfortunate Eternamax Eternatus escaped, it’s an incredible achievement to defeat it in battle.
Eternamax Eternatus is still active in the area, so you and your Pokémon have more opportunities to hone your battle strategy.
I’ll continue to document what we learned from this battle. Good luck, %PLAYERNAME%!
Earn additional rewards and instantly unlock an increased chance to encounter Shiny Pokémon in Dynamax Battles!

Purchase GO Pass Deluxe: Max Finale to unlock the following rewards!

• Increased chance of encountering Shiny Dynamax Pokémon typically found in one- through four-star Dynamax Battles
• A significant amount of Eternatus Candy and Eternatus Candy XL
• Several encounters with Dynamax Pokémon
• The Eternatus Helmet avatar item
• And much more!

Trainers can earn 50 bonus GO Points daily from August 18 to August 22, in addition to the points earned by Pass Tasks. There’s no limit on how many points can be earned during the global event on August 23 and 24!

All encounters in GO Pass: Max Finale will be with Dynamax Pokémon!
Earn additional rewards at each rank.
Earn additional rewards at each rank and instantly gain 10 ranks.
GO Pass Deluxe: Max Finale + 10 Ranks

This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
The swirl pattern in this Pokémon's body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and Sinistea gets dizzy.
This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
Infinite amounts of energy pour from this Pokémon’s enlarged core, warping the surrounding space-time.

Increased number of five-star Shadow Raids
Earn encounters with Charmander by completing the rally!
Collect stamps by visiting GO Stamp Rally PokéStops on a scenic path in the heart of Paris!
Complete this stamp rally to earn encounters with Charmander while also collecting enough Mega Energy to Mega Evolve your Charizard into Mega Charizard X or Mega Charizard Y.
This park is the closest to Les Halles, and it’s a great place to relax or take on raids. Many Trainers meet there on Community Days due to its accessibility.
Between the Louvre and the Saint-Germain-l’Auxerrois church, this spot offers a great view of Paris by the Seine river.
Place Colette is right in front of the Salle Richelieu, which hosts La Comédie-Française, France’s most famous theatre troupe.
This chalet hides under the Louvre and the Jardin des Tuileries, inside a mall built within Paris’s old walls. You can see the inverted pyramid of the Louvre, as well as multiple statues!
At the start of one of Europe’s most famous avenues, Les Champs-Élysées, you can visit one of Paris’s first parks, laid out by the famous architect and designer André Le Nôtre in 1667.
The Westfield mall in Les Halles hosts the Lumiose City tourism hub.
The Jardin des Tuileries in front of the Louvre offers a great walk during your adventure with classic Parisian sights.

This Timed Research, which challenges you to complete Field Research tasks, leads to encounters with the featured Pokémon Tyrunt and Amaura!

During the event, Pokémon encountered in this Timed Research have the same chance to be Shiny as those encountered via Field Research.

This Timed Research will be available on August 2, 2025, from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time.
